instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00840 dead
threads.message:
Draws 5.17v no current 
PPBUS_G3H not present 
PP3V3_G3H not present 
PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO
Diode mode readings 
PPBUS_G3H=0.353
PP3V3_G3H=0.373
PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO=0.340

threads.title: 820-00840 dead
threads.message:
Any history available?
Do you get 5V at R7020?
If yes, post U7000 basic voltages; P_IN, AUX_DET, VDDA/P, SMC_RST_IN, EN_VR1, SMC_RST*, AUX_OK, A/BMON.

threads.title: 820-00840 dead
threads.message:
Yes at PPDCIN_G3H
SMC_RST_IN=0.034
AUX_OK=3.341v
A/BMON=0v
VDDA/P=4.492v
AUX_DET=0.505v

threads.title: 820-00840 dead
threads.message:
Is that voltage reading?
Please, post accurate information.
We don't want "V" posted for diode mode readings, but is mandatory for voltage.

threads.title: 820-00840 dead
threads.message:
Diode mode reading is 
PM_EN_P3V3_G3H=0.611

PM_EN_P3V3_G3H voltage is 0.030volts.

threads.title: 820-00840 dead
threads.message:
"AUX_DET=0.505v"
Are you sure about this?
May have bad U7000.

threads.title: 820-00840 dead
threads.message: I checked it now TBA_AUX_DET=0 volt

threads.title: 820-00840 dead
threads.message:
"AUX_OK=3.341v"
Then this is not possible!

Check R7015/16 and traces.
If both good, change U7000.
